head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: City Joins Clean Fuel Program

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Manhattan: City Joins Clean Fuel Program

body.head.byline: By Randal C. Archibold (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: New York City joins Clean Cities campaign, effort by Energy Dept to promote use of vehicles powered by alternative power sources, like natural gas, ethanol and electricity (S)

block.p: New York City has joined the federal government's Clean Cities campaign, an effort by the Department of Energy to promote the use of vehicles powered by alternative power sources, like natural gas, ethanol and electricity. The city has the largest municipal fleet of vehicles in the country using alternative fuels, city officials said yesterday. The city also maintains partnerships with the private sector to increase the use of such vehicles, which are designed to reduce air pollution and the nation's dependence on fossil fuels. Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said the Clean Cities designation would help the city continue such programs.
